definition[0]: a substance used to cover walls and ceilings with a smooth even surface. It consists of lime, water, and sand.
definition[2]: a piece of thin material that is stuck on to the skin to cover a small wound
definition[3]: to put a wet usually sticky substance all over a surface so that it is thickly covered
example[0]: Her face was plastered with make-up.
definition[4]: to completely cover a surface with something, especially large pieces of paper, pictures etc
example[1]: The news of the wedding was plastered all over the papers  (=was the main story in the newspapers).
example[2]: The windows were plastered with notices.
definition[5]: to put wet plaster on a wall or ceiling
definition[6]: to make your hair lie flat or stick to your head
example[4]: His hair was plastered to his forehead with sweat.
example[5]: Her hair had been plastered down by the rain.
explanation[0]: Plaster is usually passive in meanings 1,2 and 4
